dismissalText.commentary: David Miller not out 85 (72b 4x4 5x6 91m) SR: 118.05

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers c Sangakkara b Mendis 47 (72b 3x4 0x6 108m) SR: 65.27

dismissalComment.html: AB's gone! And what a time for Sri Lanka to strike! Mendis pitched around off and spun the ball away from the right-hander, AB played inside the line and edged it to Sanga. AB put in so much hard work but has fallen just when he would have wanted to accelerate.

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: that's out, but I'm not sure how exactly just yet. The umpire is asking for TV replays, so maybe it's a stumping. Mendis bowled an offbreak that drew Behardien forward and then the ball spun through the gap between bat and pad. Replays show that the ball clipped the off bail on its way into Sanga's gloves so the question of a stumping does not arise. Behardien's been bowled and South Africa slump further and further.

AB's gone! And what a time for Sri Lanka to strike! Mendis pitched around off and spun the ball away from the right-hander, AB played inside the line and edged it to Sanga. AB put in so much hard work but has fallen just when he would have wanted to accelerate.

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! Mendis pitched the offbreak on middle stump and Peterson did not read it. The previous ball had come back into the left-hander and this one went away. Peterson closed the face and the ball spun past the bat to hit off stump

caught behind! Perera gets the ball to lift at pace from a good length, de Kock is caught on the crease and begins to play at it, he then stops his shot but leaves the bat hanging outside off stump, the edge flies through to Sangakkara, who takes his second catch
played on! Duminy tried to run a good length ball down to third man but it was a bit too close to him and he got an inside edge on to his stumps. South Africa's steady start is unraveling

headshotImage.caption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Alviro Petersen c Sangakkara b Malinga 8 (17b 1x4 0x6 18m) SR: 47.05

dismissalComment.html: caught behind! The bouncer works for Malinga. Petersen tried to hook it but only ended up gloving it to the keeper. That's the first short ball Malinga's bowled today and it's brought the first wicket for Sri Lanka. Petersen was early on the shot.

dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock c Sangakkara b NLTC Perera 20 (28b 3x4 0x6 55m) SR: 71.42

dismissalComment.html: caught behind! Perera gets the ball to lift at pace from a good length, de Kock is caught on the crease and begins to play at it, he then stops his shot but leaves the bat hanging outside off stump, the edge flies through to Sangakkara, who takes his second catch

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy b NLTC Perera 23 (44b 3x4 0x6 45m) SR: 52.27

dismissalComment.html: played on! Duminy tried to run a good length ball down to third man but it was a bit too close to him and he got an inside edge on to his stumps. South Africa's steady start is unraveling

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis run out (Chandimal/Sangakkara) 16 (33b 1x4 0x6 43m) SR: 48.48

dismissalComment.html: I think Faf's been run out! AB played the ball into the covers and called his partner through for a risky single. Chandimal was quick to get to the ball and he picked up and threw swiftly to the keeper. Faf is extremely quick between the wickets but he was an inch short. A severe set back to an innings already struggling for momentum.

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Farhaan Behardien b Mendis 2 (4b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: that's out, but I'm not sure how exactly just yet. The umpire is asking for TV replays, so maybe it's a stumping. Mendis bowled an offbreak that drew Behardien forward and then the ball spun through the gap between bat and pad. Replays show that the ball clipped the off bail on its way into Sanga's gloves so the question of a stumping does not arise. Behardien's been bowled and South Africa slump further and further.

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers c Sangakkara b Mendis 47 (72b 3x4 0x6 108m) SR: 65.27

dismissalComment.html: AB's gone! And what a time for Sri Lanka to strike! Mendis pitched around off and spun the ball away from the right-hander, AB played inside the line and edged it to Sanga. AB put in so much hard work but has fallen just when he would have wanted to accelerate.

headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Robin Peterson b Mendis 3 (10b 0x4 0x6 9m) SR: 30

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! Mendis pitched the offbreak on middle stump and Peterson did not read it. The previous ball had come back into the left-hander and this one went away. Peterson closed the face and the ball spun past the bat to hit off stump

dismissalText.commentary: Thisara Perera c du Plessis b Behardien 65 (49b 5x4 5x6 59m) SR: 132.65

dismissalComment.html: Perera's holed out and the ground has gone dead quiet! He tried to clear the wide long-on boundary, slogging a short and slower ball from outside off stump. I think he made contact with the bottom of the bat and it turned in his hand, slicing the ball high in the air. It isn't Lopsy under the catch this time, it's Faf du Plessis running in from long on and he catches it comfortably. Faf's been awesome in the field all night.

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Dinesh Chandimal c de Kock b McLaren 29 (65b 4x4 0x6 82m) SR: 44.61

dismissalComment.html: the bowling change has worked for AB! After several overs of spin and gentle medium, he brings back his quick. McLaren gets the ball to lift sharply from short of a length and Chandimal is in a tangle as he attempts to fend it off. The ball seems to hold its line around off and grazes the outside edge through to de Kock. Looks like that came off the glove actually.

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: such a soft dismissal! Dilshan tried to drive a short of a length ball on the up as it angled across him and ended up spooning it towards extra cover, where AB de Villiers ran to his left from mid-off to take a simple catch

Sanga's gone! Caught at cover! The ball was on a length outside off and it moved away from Sangakkara a touch, drawing the left-hander into the drive. Sangakkara went after it and only succeeded in giving Duminy a head-high catch

Morkel is softening them up and Tsotsobe is reaping the rewards with some tight bowling too. Short of a length outside off, the ball bounces sharply, shapes away from the left-hander and hits the outside edge as Tharanga prods from his crease. Petersen takes the catch at first slip at head height

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalComment.html: what a poor shot that is. Mathews tried to pull a short of a length ball as it angled across him, so he was trying to hit against the line. He got a top edge that lobbed to extra cover, where de Villiers was waiting. Tsotsobe has his fourth!

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Perea player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Perea player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: Perera's debut innings is a brief one, he tries to pull one that isn't too short and the top edge lobs tamely to AB de Villiers at midwicket, there was a bit of extra bounce for the bowler

Perera's holed out and the ground has gone dead quiet! He tried to clear the wide long-on boundary, slogging a short and slower ball from outside off stump. I think he made contact with the bottom of the bat and it turned in his hand, slicing the ball high in the air. It isn't Lopsy under the catch this time, it's Faf du Plessis running in from long on and he catches it comfortably. Faf's been awesome in the field all night.
knocked him over! Malinga clears his front foot and slogs wildly. The good length ball clips the top of off stump, South Africa only need one more

dismissalComment.html: Morkel is softening them up and Tsotsobe is reaping the rewards with some tight bowling too. Short of a length outside off, the ball bounces sharply, shapes away from the left-hander and hits the outside edge as Tharanga prods from his crease. Petersen takes the catch at first slip at head height

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene b Peterson 24 (51b 0x4 0x6 88m) SR: 47.05

dismissalComment.html: he's bowled him through the gate, would you believe it! Mahela played for the turn away from the right-hander but it did not spin, instead it pitched outside off and went on the the arm, sliding through the bat-pad gap and crashing into middle and leg stump

dismissalComment.html: knocked him over! Malinga clears his front foot and slogs wildly. The good length ball clips the top of off stump, South Africa only need one more

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ajantha Mendis c Tsotsobe b Duminy 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Tsotsobe has taken an excellent catch at backward point to end the game! He is pumped as he flings the ball in the air in celebration. Mendis came down the pitch and tried to hit down the ground but the ball flew flat and quickly off the outside edge, Tsotsobe moves to his right and dives to take it.

batsmen.shot: off side drive on front foot

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ajantha Mendis c Tsotsobe b Duminy 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

commentPreTextItems.html: Mr. G: "Something to ponder on for Robbie P- Thisara was at ease carting him for 35, yet struggled to do the same against AB and Behardien. Lesson to be learnt perhaps?"

commentTextItems.html: Tsotsobe has taken an excellent catch at backward point to end the game! He is pumped as he flings the ball in the air in celebration. Mendis came down the pitch and tried to hit down the ground but the ball flew flat and quickly off the outside edge, Tsotsobe moves to his right and dives to take it.

commentPostTextItems.html: 9.55 pm South Africa stay alive in this series and the scoreline is now 2-1 in Sri Lanka's favour with two to play. This is only the second time South Africa have beaten Sri Lanka in Sri Lanka, after their maiden victory in 1993. That's quite a long wait.

It did not look like it would happen when South Africa's top and middle order struggled for direction and it needed an explosive finish from David Miller to give them a defendable total. Then Mokel and Tsotsobe cut open the Sri Lankan innings with the new ball and South Africa were favourites after that, despite a brutal assault from Thisara Perera late in the piece.
Amar: "I would be really surprised if Tsotsobe gets the Man of the Match instead of Miller keeping in mind Tsotsobe dropping a dolly which could have cost them the game!"
Nawaz Ahmed: "I think T Perera should get some award or recognition for his five 6's and a 4." Isn't appreciation enough?

And here's the presentation ... David Miller is the Man of the Match for a half-century that transformed South Africa's innings. He says it was hard to bat all through the innings, and possible the match. "We only went in the last two overs, would have been nice if we went earlier but the conditions did not allow for that."

Angelo Mathews: "I thought the bowlers did a brilliant job, we were good on the field. Except for the last three overs we did well. The batters had to tough it out. Thisara Perera looked like he was batting on a different strip. He's turning out to be a brilliant allrounder. I got out at the wrong time, with Thisara at the other end, I should have hung around a bit ..."

AB: "It's hard to explain how proud I am of the boys. It wasn't easy. We were under pressure through the game. After losing Ryan McLaren, I found out in the 30th over that he wasn't going to bowl anymore and that was a shock. I threw Robin Peterson in the deep end ... it was a good performance. Morne was quite aggressive today, he really set the standard up front ... once again we maybe did not have enough partnership and an unnecessary run out, I take responsibility there, Faf was looking really good ..."
That's all we have for you today on the commentary. Andrew Fernando will be filing his stories from Pallekele and do check out Firdose Moonda's updated match report.
Thank you for all your emails today, good night!

commentTextItems.html: Herath plays the reverse sweep to short third man

commentPreTextItems.html: Mendis is the last man for Sri Lanka. What a stunning job Duminy and Behardien have done for South Africa, with the ball.
Johan: "I'd like to see who's man of the match here. Probably Millar for playing what could be a career-defining knock, but Duminy's contribution with the ball should not be underestimated..."

commentTextItems.html: nearly in the blockhole, Mendis defends from the crease

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Lasith Malinga b Behardien 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 0

commentTextItems.html: knocked him over! Malinga clears his front foot and slogs wildly. The good length ball clips the top of off stump, South Africa only need one more
Herath lofts the ball towards long off, mis-timed it
pitches on a good length and seams away from Herath, who pokes and is beaten

commentPreTextItems.html: And with that you'd say South Africa will win this now. Malinga is the new batsman.

commentTextItems.html: Herath immediately swipes at a short of a length ball outside off and is beaten

dismissalText.commentary: Thisara Perera c du Plessis b Behardien 65 (49b 5x4 5x6 59m) SR: 132.65

commentPreTextItems.html: King: "After that pull by Herath, question is- which ballpark were Mahela and Chandimal playing at?"

commentTextItems.html: Perera's holed out and the ground has gone dead quiet! He tried to clear the wide long-on boundary, slogging a short and slower ball from outside off stump. I think he made contact with the bottom of the bat and it turned in his hand, slicing the ball high in the air. It isn't Lopsy under the catch this time, it's Faf du Plessis running in from long on and he catches it comfortably. Faf's been awesome in the field all night.
strides forward and defends on the off side
played towards square leg for a single
nudged towards midwicket for a very risky single because Duminy sprints towards the ball, picks up, turns around and throws at the bowler's end. Had he hit, Herath was gone.
bowled into the blockhole outside off stump, Herath tries to dig it out and plays to third man
played to long on for a single, Duminy's darting them in from round the wicket

commentPreTextItems.html: nick: "Nice gesture by AB after the 2nd ball, consoling Tsotsobe."
Mr. G: "I reckon AB will have JP bowl two more overs. Thisara looks more comfortable with the extra pace- somebody with variations required here."

commentTextItems.html: Perera goes back to the spinner an dabs the ball to short third man
worked off the pads through square leg for a single
nudged from the crease towards midwicket and they run a quick single
gets on to the front foot and defends calmly now
is that Herath pulling? It is. Rocks back to a short ball and powers it into the gap on the midwicket boundary
short of a length with extra bounce outside off, Herath has a swish but misses

commentPreTextItems.html: Only 68 needed off the last ten, with Perera in thunderous hitting form and three wickets in hand.

commentTextItems.html: a full ball around off, played off the front foot to point

dismissalComment.html: caught behind! The bouncer works for Malinga. Petersen tried to hook it but only ended up gloving it to the keeper. That's the first short ball Malinga's bowled today and it's brought the first wicket for Sri Lanka. Petersen was early on the shot.

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

dismissalComment.html: caught behind! Perera gets the ball to lift at pace from a good length, de Kock is caught on the crease and begins to play at it, he then stops his shot but leaves the bat hanging outside off stump, the edge flies through to Sangakkara, who takes his second catch
played on! Duminy tried to run a good length ball down to third man but it was a bit too close to him and he got an inside edge on to his stumps. South Africa's steady start is unraveling

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: that's out, but I'm not sure how exactly just yet. The umpire is asking for TV replays, so maybe it's a stumping. Mendis bowled an offbreak that drew Behardien forward and then the ball spun through the gap between bat and pad. Replays show that the ball clipped the off bail on its way into Sanga's gloves so the question of a stumping does not arise. Behardien's been bowled and South Africa slump further and further.

AB's gone! And what a time for Sri Lanka to strike! Mendis pitched around off and spun the ball away from the right-hander, AB played inside the line and edged it to Sanga. AB put in so much hard work but has fallen just when he would have wanted to accelerate.

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! Mendis pitched the offbreak on middle stump and Peterson did not read it. The previous ball had come back into the left-hander and this one went away. Peterson closed the face and the ball spun past the bat to hit off stump

headshotImage.caption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Alviro Petersen c Sangakkara b Malinga 8 (17b 1x4 0x6 18m) SR: 47.05

dismissalComment.html: caught behind! The bouncer works for Malinga. Petersen tried to hook it but only ended up gloving it to the keeper. That's the first short ball Malinga's bowled today and it's brought the first wicket for Sri Lanka. Petersen was early on the shot.

dismissalText.commentary: Quinton de Kock c Sangakkara b NLTC Perera 20 (28b 3x4 0x6 55m) SR: 71.42

dismissalComment.html: caught behind! Perera gets the ball to lift at pace from a good length, de Kock is caught on the crease and begins to play at it, he then stops his shot but leaves the bat hanging outside off stump, the edge flies through to Sangakkara, who takes his second catch

dismissalText.commentary: Jean-Paul Duminy b NLTC Perera 23 (44b 3x4 0x6 45m) SR: 52.27

dismissalComment.html: played on! Duminy tried to run a good length ball down to third man but it was a bit too close to him and he got an inside edge on to his stumps. South Africa's steady start is unraveling

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Faf du Plessis run out (Chandimal/Sangakkara) 16 (33b 1x4 0x6 43m) SR: 48.48

dismissalComment.html: I think Faf's been run out! AB played the ball into the covers and called his partner through for a risky single. Chandimal was quick to get to the ball and he picked up and threw swiftly to the keeper. Faf is extremely quick between the wickets but he was an inch short. A severe set back to an innings already struggling for momentum.

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Farhaan Behardien b Mendis 2 (4b 0x4 0x6 10m) SR: 50

dismissalComment.html: that's out, but I'm not sure how exactly just yet. The umpire is asking for TV replays, so maybe it's a stumping. Mendis bowled an offbreak that drew Behardien forward and then the ball spun through the gap between bat and pad. Replays show that the ball clipped the off bail on its way into Sanga's gloves so the question of a stumping does not arise. Behardien's been bowled and South Africa slump further and further.

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers c Sangakkara b Mendis 47 (72b 3x4 0x6 108m) SR: 65.27

dismissalComment.html: AB's gone! And what a time for Sri Lanka to strike! Mendis pitched around off and spun the ball away from the right-hander, AB played inside the line and edged it to Sanga. AB put in so much hard work but has fallen just when he would have wanted to accelerate.

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Robin Peterson b Mendis 3 (10b 0x4 0x6 9m) SR: 30

dismissalComment.html: bowled him! Mendis pitched the offbreak on middle stump and Peterson did not read it. The previous ball had come back into the left-hander and this one went away. Peterson closed the face and the ball spun past the bat to hit off stump

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Alviro Petersen player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Upul Tharanga c Petersen b Tsotsobe 5 (23b 1x4 0x6 32m) SR: 21.73

dismissalComment.html: Morkel is softening them up and Tsotsobe is reaping the rewards with some tight bowling too. Short of a length outside off, the ball bounces sharply, shapes away from the left-hander and hits the outside edge as Tharanga prods from his crease. Petersen takes the catch at first slip at head height

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Tillakaratne Dilshan c de Villiers b Tsotsobe 6 (8b 1x4 0x6 13m) SR: 75

dismissalComment.html: such a soft dismissal! Dilshan tried to drive a short of a length ball on the up as it angled across him and ended up spooning it towards extra cover, where AB de Villiers ran to his left from mid-off to take a simple catch

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Kumar Sangakkara c Duminy b Tsotsobe 0 (3b 0x4 0x6 3m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Sanga's gone! Caught at cover! The ball was on a length outside off and it moved away from Sangakkara a touch, drawing the left-hander into the drive. Sangakkara went after it and only succeeded in giving Duminy a head-high catch

headshotImage.caption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Robin Peterson player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Mahela Jayawardene b Peterson 24 (51b 0x4 0x6 88m) SR: 47.05

dismissalComment.html: he's bowled him through the gate, would you believe it! Mahela played for the turn away from the right-hander but it did not spin, instead it pitched outside off and went on the the arm, sliding through the bat-pad gap and crashing into middle and leg stump

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Dinesh Chandimal, player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ryan McLaren player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Dinesh Chandimal c de Kock b McLaren 29 (65b 4x4 0x6 82m) SR: 44.61

dismissalComment.html: the bowling change has worked for AB! After several overs of spin and gentle medium, he brings back his quick. McLaren gets the ball to lift sharply from short of a length and Chandimal is in a tangle as he attempts to fend it off. The ball seems to hold its line around off and grazes the outside edge through to de Kock. Looks like that came off the glove actually.

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Mathews, player page headshot cutout 2023

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Mathews c de Villiers b Tsotsobe 14 (20b 1x4 0x6 29m) SR: 70

dismissalComment.html: what a poor shot that is. Mathews tried to pull a short of a length ball as it angled across him, so he was trying to hit against the line. He got a top edge that lobbed to extra cover, where de Villiers was waiting. Tsotsobe has his fourth!

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Perea player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Perea player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Angelo Perea player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Angelo Perea player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Angelo Perera c de Villiers b Behardien 1 (5b 0x4 0x6 5m) SR: 20

dismissalComment.html: Perera's debut innings is a brief one, he tries to pull one that isn't too short and the top edge lobs tamely to AB de Villiers at midwicket, there was a bit of extra bounce for the bowler

dismissalText.commentary: Thisara Perera c du Plessis b Behardien 65 (49b 5x4 5x6 59m) SR: 132.65

dismissalComment.html: Perera's holed out and the ground has gone dead quiet! He tried to clear the wide long-on boundary, slogging a short and slower ball from outside off stump. I think he made contact with the bottom of the bat and it turned in his hand, slicing the ball high in the air. It isn't Lopsy under the catch this time, it's Faf du Plessis running in from long on and he catches it comfortably. Faf's been awesome in the field all night.

dismissalText.commentary: Rangana Herath not out 12 (33b 1x4 0x6 52m) SR: 36.36
Lasith Malinga b Behardien 0 (1b 0x4 0x6 4m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: knocked him over! Malinga clears his front foot and slogs wildly. The good length ball clips the top of off stump, South Africa only need one more

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ajantha Mendis player page headshot cutout, 2021

headshotImage.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalText.commentary: Ajantha Mendis c Tsotsobe b Duminy 0 (2b 0x4 0x6 2m) SR: 0

dismissalComment.html: Tsotsobe has taken an excellent catch at backward point to end the game! He is pumped as he flings the ball in the air in celebration. Mendis came down the pitch and tried to hit down the ground but the ball flew flat and quickly off the outside edge, Tsotsobe moves to his right and dives to take it.

notes: South Africa innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 33 runs, 1 wicket)
South Africa: 50 runs in 13.1 overs (79 balls), Extras 1
Drinks: South Africa - 53/3 in 15.4 overs (AB de Villiers 1)
Over 17.1: Review by Sri Lanka (Bowling), Umpire - REJ Martinesz, Batsman - AB de Villiers (Struck down)
South Africa: 100 runs in 27.6 overs (168 balls), Extras 1
Powerplay 2: Overs 33.1 - 38.0 (Batting side - 25 runs, 0 wicket)
Drinks: South Africa - 126/5 in 35.0 overs (AB de Villiers 41, DA Miller 15)
South Africa: 150 runs in 40.1 overs (241 balls), Extras 2
DA Miller: 50 off 62 balls (2 x 4, 1 x 6)
South Africa: 200 runs in 48.3 overs (291 balls), Extras 4
8th Wicket: 50 runs in 43 balls (DA Miller 34, R McLaren 13, Ex 3)
Innings Break: South Africa - 223/7 in 50.0 overs (DA Miller 85, R McLaren 14)
Sri Lanka innings
Powerplay 1: Overs 0.1 - 10.0 (Mandatory - 24 runs, 3 wickets)
Over 13.5: Review by South Africa (Bowling), Umpire - REJ Martinesz, Batsman - DPMD Jayawardene (Struck down)
Drinks: Sri Lanka - 39/3 in 15.0 overs (DPMD Jayawardene 8, LD Chandimal 13)
Sri Lanka: 50 runs in 18.4 overs (112 balls), Extras 7
4th Wicket: 50 runs in 91 balls (DPMD Jayawardene 22, LD Chandimal 26, Ex 2)
Sri Lanka: 100 runs in 32.1 overs (193 balls), Extras 10
Powerplay 2: Overs 35.1 - 40.0 (Batting side - 24 runs, 0 wicket)
NLTC Perera: 50 off 33 balls (3 x 4, 5 x 6)
8th Wicket: 50 runs in 40 balls (NLTC Perera 47, HMRKB Herath 2, Ex 1)
Sri Lanka: 150 runs in 38.4 overs (232 balls), Extras 11

milestones.description: Sangakkara has scored 90 fifty-plus scores in ODIs, the most for SL breaking Jayasuriya's record

stories.title: Inconsistency haunts Tharanga...again
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Pallekele
stories.summary: Some days, Upul Tharanga bats so well, his innings seem like a dream. Other times, he falls asleep at the crease. It is a vacillating pattern he must arrest immediately, with the team's batting future at stake

image.caption: Morne Morkel and David Miller celebrate Upul Tharanga's wicket
image.longCaption: Morne Morkel and David Miller celebrate Upul Tharanga's wicket, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Colombo, July 23, 2013

stories.title: De Villiers lauds team's character under pressure
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Pallekele
stories.seoTitle: De Villiers lauds team's character under pressure
stories.summary: There were moments in the third ODI that bore the hallmarks of a classic South Africa meltdown, but after the match the captain AB de Villiers lauded his side's strength under pressure

image.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe is jubilant after dismissing Upul Tharanga
image.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe is jubilant after dismissing Upul Tharanga, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Pallekele, July 26, 2013

stories.title: Perera punishes Peterson
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Pallekele
stories.seoTitle: Plays of the day: Thisara Perera punishes Robin Peterson
stories.summary: Plays of the day from the third ODI between Sri Lanka and South Africa

image.caption: Thisara Perera's bottom hand comes off the bat
image.longCaption: Thisara Perera's bottom hand comes off the bat, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Pallekele, July 26, 2013

stories.title: Thirty-five runs in an over
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Pallekele
stories.summary: The 33rd over of Sri Lanka's innings, bowled by Robin Peterson, cost 35 runs. Here's how Thisara Perera did it

image.caption: Thisara Perera hoists the ball into the leg side
image.longCaption: Thisara Perera hoists the ball into the leg side, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Pallekele, July 26, 2013

stories.title: Miller, Tsotsobe keep series alive
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Pallekele
stories.seoTitle: David Miller, Lonwabo Tsotsobe keep series alive
stories.summary: South Africa dictated proceedings for the first time in the series as they beat Sri Lanka by 56 runs

image.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe dismissed Tillakaratne Dilshan for 6
image.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe dismissed Tillakaratne Dilshan for 6, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Pallekele, July 26, 2013

stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Pallekele

stories.summary: ESPNcricinfo presents the preview of the third ODI between Sri Lanka and South Africa in Pallekele

image.longCaption: Angelo Mathews talks to coach Graham Ford during a practice session, Pallekele, July 25, 2013

videos.title: AB de Villiers targets improved performance
videos.seoTitle: AB de Villiers targets improved performance
videos.summary: South Africa captain AB de Villiers has backed his side to avoid defeat in their third ODI against Sri Lanka on Friday

galleries.title: Miller sets up rare victory
galleries.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Pallekele

image.caption: Lasith Malinga is elated after dismissing Alviro Petersen early
image.longCaption: Lasith Malinga is elated after dismissing Alviro Petersen early, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Pallekele, July 26, 2013

stories.title: Inconsistency haunts Tharanga...again
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Pallekele
stories.summary: Some days, Upul Tharanga bats so well, his innings seem like a dream. Other times, he falls asleep at the crease. It is a vacillating pattern he must arrest immediately, with the team's batting future at stake

image.caption: Morne Morkel and David Miller celebrate Upul Tharanga's wicket
image.longCaption: Morne Morkel and David Miller celebrate Upul Tharanga's wicket, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 2nd ODI, Colombo, July 23, 2013

stories.title: De Villiers lauds team's character under pressure
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Pallekele
stories.seoTitle: De Villiers lauds team's character under pressure
stories.summary: There were moments in the third ODI that bore the hallmarks of a classic South Africa meltdown, but after the match the captain AB de Villiers lauded his side's strength under pressure

image.caption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe is jubilant after dismissing Upul Tharanga
image.longCaption: Lonwabo Tsotsobe is jubilant after dismissing Upul Tharanga, Sri Lanka v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Pallekele, July 26, 2013

stories.title: Thirty-five runs in an over
stories.subTitle: Sri Lanka v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Pallekele
stories.summary: The 33rd over of Sri Lanka's innings, bowled by Robin Peterson, cost 35 runs. Here's how Thisara Perera did it
